value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of what they saw-- a flat fen, reed whispering, water</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">logged; or a down still covered with turf only.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">On the down is the green scar still, to mark the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">road along which the travellers came, past the circle where</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">they were buried; past the stone that marks the meeting place</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">xxxxxxx <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-anon" key="Anon">Anon</rs> sings because love and spring make him</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">vocal or the horror of winter dark <add hand="typewriter" place="above">But</add>, who listens? Somebody</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">heard that particular song, or it would not have been written</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">down. The singer then had his 
            <choice>
              <sic>audeince</sic>
              <corr>audience</corr>
            </choice>; but the audience was</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">so little interested in his name that he never thought to</l>
